channel.title: Adding a TOS like moparscape
channel.description:
I've posted this before, but cocky mods locked it for no reason.
So i've got the PHP file of the TOS, now how can i make my website redirect to it?
I'm using vbulletin.
Moderators, please do not close this until my questions are satisfied.

item.title: Adding a TOS like moparscape
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“abatssk8ter, post:7, topic:379753”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=475595.msg3478129#msg3478129 date=1295852437]
If you have the file, did you try looking at the comment at the top of the file which tells you exactly what to do? Maybe that’s why the mods were ‘cocky’.
[/quote]It tells me i have to add that statement to the top of each page? so i have to add it to every single php page on vbulletin?[/quote]

That sounds like vbulletin to me. If you used real forum software you would just put it at the top of index.php.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding a TOS like moparscape
item.dc:creator: @abatssk8ter abatssk8ter
item.description:
@abatssk8ter wrote:

Could you give me the location of it? and what they are?
Still learning, sorry.
Oh and before you say so, i’ve tried googling.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding a TOS like moparscape
item.dc:creator: @abatssk8ter abatssk8ter
item.description:
@abatssk8ter wrote:

Adding the if statement to a pages markup that allows the page to be redirected to the agreement on my website.
Can you understand that?

item.title: Adding a TOS like moparscape
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“abatssk8ter, post:9, topic:379753”][quote author=m.dog311 link=topic=475595.msg3478262#msg3478262 date=1295874444]

[quote author=abatssk8ter link=topic=475595.msg3478261#msg3478261 date=1295874354]

If you have the file, did you try looking at the comment at the top of the file which tells you exactly what to do? Maybe that’s why the mods were ‘cocky’.
[/quote]It tells me i have to add that statement to the top of each page? so i have to add it to every single php page on vbulletin?

Or learn to use the vB template system…
[/quote]What do you think i’m trying to do?[/quote]
From the sounds of it, you don’t even know what you’re trying to do.

item.title: Adding a TOS like moparscape
item.dc:creator: @abatssk8ter abatssk8ter
item.description:
@abatssk8ter wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I, post:1, topic:379775”]abat; you have the cookies, and don’t add it to the header of one file.

Login to the admin panel or w.e it’s called, modify your template, and put it in the Breadcrumbs for the header.

That will work for all pages.[/quote]

Tried editing it at the top of the template,

<vb: if(!isset($_COOKIE["mpr_agree"])) header("Location: http://".$_SERVER['SERVER_NAME'].($_SERVER['SERVER_PORT'] == 80 ? '' : ':'.$_SERVER['SERVER_PORT'])."/agreement.php?returnto=http://".$_SERVER['SERVER_NAME'].($_SERVER['SERVER_PORT'] == 80 ? '' : ':'.$_SERVER['SERVER_PORT']).$_SERVER['PHP_SELF']);>

Did not work, any suggestions?

Read full topic

item.title: Adding a TOS like moparscape
item.dc:creator: @abatssk8ter abatssk8ter
item.description:
@abatssk8ter wrote:

I added that, into index.php. But it only redirects this page http://battle-ages.com/vb
Is there a way i can make EVERY page on my website be directed to it, like here on moparscape.

@Davidi2, I had more questions on the subject so please leave, you have no business posting here.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding a TOS like moparscape
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Protip - Don’t call mods cocky for doing the right thing.

Not only has your question be asked (and answered!) before, the other person actually had the initiative to google the terms we suggested, and then ask questions on the result.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding a TOS like moparscape
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

if (!isset ($_COOKIE[‘cookiename’]))
header (“Location: nocookie.php”);
else
header (“Location: foundcookie.php”);

Put at the top of index

Read full topic
